escrow contract for secure P2P trading with dispute resolution","errors":{"AccessControlBadConfirmation()":[{"details":"The caller of a function is not the expected one. NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}."}],"AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount(address,bytes32)":[{"details":"The `account` is missing a role."}],"EnforcedPause()":[{"details":"The operation failed because the contract is paused."}],"ExpectedPause()":[{"details":"The operation failed because the contract is not paused."}],"ReentrancyGuardReentrantCall()":[{"details":"Unauthorized reentrant call."}]},"events":{"Paused(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the pause is triggered by `account`."},"RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32)":{"details":"Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted to signal this."},"RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call. This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"},"Unpaused(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account`."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"approveEscrow(uint256)":{"details":"Approve multi-sig escrow"},"autoRelease(uint256)":{"details":"Auto-release funds after dispute window expires","params":{"_escrowId":"ID of the escrow"}},"batchCreateEscrows(address[],uint256[],uint256[],string[])":{"details":"Batch create multiple escrows"},"calculateUserFee(address,uint256)":{"details":"Calculate fee for a specific user based on their subscription","params":{"_amount":"The escrow amount","_user":"The user address"},"returns":{"fee":"The calculated fee"}},"cancelEscrow(uint256)":{"details":"Cancel an unfunded escrow","params":{"_escrowId":"ID of the escrow"}},"confirmDelivery(uint256)":{"details":"Confirm delivery and release funds (called by buyer)","params":{"_escrowId":"ID of the escrow"}},"constructor":{"details":"Constructor","params":{"_feeRecipient":"Address to receive platform fees"}},"createEscrow(address,uint256,uint256,string)":{"details":"Create a new escrow (basic version for backward compatibility)","params":{"_amount":"Amount to be escrowed (excluding fee)","_disputeWindow":"Custom dispute window (0 for default)","_metadata":"Optional metadata string","_seller":"Address of the seller"},"returns":{"escrowId":"The ID of the created escrow"}},"createEscrowWithTemplate(address,uint256,uint256,string,string,address[])":{"details":"Create a new escrow with enhanced features","params":{"_amount":"Amount to be escrowed (excluding fee)","_approvers":"Optional array of approvers for multi-sig","_disputeWindow":"Custom dispute window (0 for default)","_metadata":"Optional metadata string","_seller":"Address of the seller","_templateId":"Optional template ID for predefined settings"},"returns":{"escrowId":"The ID of the created escrow"}},"fundEscrow(uint256)":{"details":"Fund an existing escrow","params":{"_escrowId":"ID of the escrow to fund"}},"getActiveEscrows(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Get active escrows (paginated)","params":{"limit":"Number of escrows to return","offset":"Starting index"},"returns":{"count":"Total number of active escrows","escrowIds":"Array of escrow IDs"}},"getAvailableFees()":{"details":"Get available fees for withdrawal","returns":{"_0":"availableFees Amount available for withdrawal"}},"getDisputeDetails(uint256)":{"details":"Get dispute details for an escrow","params":{"_escrowId":"ID of the escrow"}},"getDisputedEscrows()":{"details":"Get disputed escrows","returns":{"escrowIds":"Array of disputed escrow IDs"}},"getEscrowDetails(uint256)":{"details":"Get escrow basic details","params":{"_escrowId":"ID of the escrow"}},"getEscrowStats()":{"details":"Get escrow statistics","returns":{"activeEscrows":"Number of active escrows","availableFees":"Available fees for withdrawal","completedEscrows":"Number of completed escrows","disputedEscrows":"Number of disputed escrows","feesCollected":"Total fees collected","totalEscrows":"Total number of escrows created","totalVolume":"Total volume locked in escrows"}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"getUserEscrows(address)":{"details":"Get user's escrow IDs","params":{"_user":"Address of the user"},"returns":{"_0":"Array of escrow IDs"}},"getUserFeePercentage(address)":{"details":"Get the fee percentage for a specific user","params":{"_user":"The user address"},"returns":{"_0":"Fee percentage in basis points"}},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"markDelivered(uint256)":{"details":"Mark delivery as complete (called by seller)","params":{"_escrowId":"ID of the escrow"}},"pause()":{"details":"Pause the contract"},"paused()":{"details":"Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise."},"raiseDispute(uint256,string)":{"details":"Raise a dispute","params":{"_escrowId":"ID of the escrow","_reason":"Reason for the dispute"}},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"resolveDispute(uint256,bool,string)":{"details":"Resolve a dispute (admin/arbitrator only)","params":{"_escrowId":"ID of the escrow","_refundToBuyer":"Whether to refund to buyer (true) or release to seller (false)","_resolution":"Resolution details"}},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"setEscrowTemplate(string,uint256,uint256,bool,uint256)":{"details":"Create or update escrow template"},"setSubscriptionManager(address)":{"details":"Set the SubscriptionManager contract address","params":{"_subscriptionManager":"Address of the SubscriptionManager contract"}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas."},"unpause()":{"details":"Unpause the contract"},"updateDefaultDisputeWindow(uint256)":{"details":"Update default dispute autoRelease(uint256).details: Auto-release funds after dispute window expires

calculateUserFee(address,uint256).details: Calculate fee for a specific user based on their subscription

confirmDelivery(uint256).details: Confirm delivery and release funds (called by buyer)

createEscrow(address,uint256,uint256,str.details: Create a new escrow (basic version for backward compatibility)

returns.escrowId: The ID of the created escrow

createEscrowWithTemplate(address,uint256.details: Create a new escrow with enhanced features

params._approvers: Optional array of approvers for multi-sig
params._templateId: Optional template ID for predefined settings

returns.escrowId: The ID of the created escrow

params._escrowId: ID of the escrow to fund

getDisputeDetails(uint256).details: Get dispute details for an escrow

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getUserFeePercentage(address).details: Get the fee percentage for a specific user

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

markDelivered(uint256).details: Mark delivery as complete (called by seller)

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params._refundToBuyer: Whether to refund to buyer (true) or release to seller (false)

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.
